message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NA, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.SP. 

The paper deals with the reconstruction of signals from irregularly spaced samples, which is a common problem in signal processing and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses linear reconstruction techniques, which are commonly used in numerical analysis and scientific computing, suggesting cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) as another likely sub-category. The paper also deals with the quality of the reconstructed signal, which is a topic of interest in machine learning and data analysis, suggesting cs.LG (Machine Learning) as a possible sub-category. The paper also deals with the eigenvalue distribution of a matrix, which is a topic of interest in linear algebra and optimization, suggesting cs.SI (Systems and Control) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the mean-square error (MSE) of the reconstructed field, which is a topic of interest in signal processing and statistical inference, suggesting cs.SP (Signal Processing) as a possible sub-category.
